qas.question: What was Chancellor Wrighton's initial sentiment to hosting another presidential debate at Washington University after 2004?

answers.text: it would be "improbable" that the university will host another debate and was not eager to commit to the possibility

qas.question: What did  Chancellor Wrighton state as one of the reasons for hosting another debate at Washington University?

answers.text: These one-of-a-kind events are great experiences for our students, they contribute to a national understanding of important issues

qas.question: What year did Chancellor Wrighton submit another bid for a presidential debate at Washington University after 2004?
In what year did Wrighton become Chancellor?
Who said it would be "probable" that their university would ask to host another debate in 2004?
Who said "These common events are a great experience for our students..." in 2008?
What type of events bring local attention to the St. Louis region?
What was the very first year that Washington University hosted a presidential debate?

context: Although <b4_0><b5_0>Chancellor Wrighton<b5_0/><b4_0/> had noted after the <b3_0><b7_0>2004<b7_0/><b3_0/> debate that <a0_0>it would be "improbable" that the university will host another <b6_0>debate<b6_0/> and was not eager to commit to the possibility<a0_0/>, he subsequently changed his view and the university submitted a bid for the <a2_0>2008<a2_0/> debates. "<a1_0>These one-of-a-kind events are great experiences for our students, they contribute to a national understanding of important issues<a1_0/>, and they allow us to help bring national and international attention to the St. Louis region as one of America's great metropolitan areas," said Wrighton.
